greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A003961(n)*A006519(n).
comment: Completely multiplicative since both A003961 and A006519 are. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Jul 25 2018
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10001
formula: a(p_k) = p_(k+1) for odd prime p.
example: a(1) = 1 since 1 is the empty product.
a(2) = 6 because 2 = 2^1 in form p_k^e; switching p_(k+1) for p, we have 3^1 = 3, and the largest power of 2 dividing 2 is 2^1 = 2; thus 3 * 2 = 6.
mathematica: Array[(Times @@ Map[#1^#2 & @@ # &, FactorInteger[#] /. {p_, e_} /; e > 0 :> {Prime[PrimePi@ p + 1], e}] - Boole[# == 1])*2^IntegerExponent[#, 2] &, 75] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Dec 29 2019 *)
program: (PARI) a(n)={my(f=factor(n)); prod(i=1, #f~, my(p=f[i,1], e=f[i,2]); if(p==2, 6, nextprime(p+1))^e)} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Jul 25 2018
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 19 2017
